isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 2.2: HARD START/NO START DIAGNOSTICS - T 444E ENGINE - INJECTION CONTROL PRESSURE

svcprocinfo.para:
Refer to Table 2.14
for the injection control pressure test.

table.title: Table 2.14 Injection Control Pressure Test FROM FORM EGED-195

entry.para: • Minimum 130 RPM engine cranking speed for 20 sec.
• Measure w/breakout box connected to Engine Harness (upper connector) on ECM @ pins 16+ &19- or breakout "tee' signal (green) & ground (black)

para.emph: If pressure is low, recheck oil in reservoir
If pressure still low, refer to diagnostic publication EGES-190 for system leakage tests

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if the injection control pressure system is supplying sufficient oil pressure to start and operate the engine. This is an alternate method to be used if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is unavailable or fails to function properly. Insufficient electrical power from the batteries or an electronic failure may inhibit the EST from receiving diagnostic data.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure
svcsubproc.para:
Measuring injection control pressure using breakout box ( Figure 2.30
).

step1.para: Remove the 60 way connector engine (upper) connector harness from the ECM.
Install breakout box adapter connector to the engine connection on the ECM. Reconnect engine harness connector to the breakout box adapter connector.

note.para: Torque connector to ECM to 35 in. lbs.

step1.para: Connect the positive lead of the DVOM to terminal 16 and the negative lead to terminal 19.

Crank the engine while observing the DVOM and record the injection control pressure voltage signal on diagnostic form. If Injection Control Pressure (ICP) pressure is low, refer to High Pressure Leakage Tests.

figure.caption: Figure 2.30 Measuring Injection Control Pressure Using Breakout Box (ZTSE-4445)

svcsubproc.title: Alternate Method Of Measuring Injection Control Pressure Using (Breakout "Tee")

step1.para: Remove engine harness connector at ICP sensor.
Connect the breakout "TEE" (ZTSE-4347) to the removed engine harness connector and the ICP sensor.

Connect DVOM leads (+Green, -Black) to the breakout "TEE" as shown in Figure 2.31
.

Crank engine and observe DVOM voltage reading. Record reading on diagnostic form. If voltage is low, recheck oil level in reservoir to confirm the reservoir contains a sufficient supply of oil to enable the injection control system to function properly. If oil level is ok, proceed to High Pressure Leakage.

svcsubproc.title: Possible Causes
svcsubproc.para: Low injection pressure (voltage) indicates the injectors are not receiving sufficient oil pressure to properly operate the fuel injectors. This may be caused by:

item.para: Oil reservoir leak down (possibly through high pressure pump check valve.
Pump drive gear loose or damaged.

svcsubproc.title: Tools Required
svcsubproc.para: PRO-LINK 9000 (ZTSE-43661) or DVOM and ICP sensor breakout "T" (ZTSE-4347).

item.para: Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) diagnostics, in Electronic Control System Diagnostics, Section 3.
